Using the relationship derived in ref. 56 (their equation 1), we converted the output of dust load from the seven CMIP5 models (Supplementary Table S1) to DOD as the following,

τ = M × e ,
where τ is DOD at 500 nm, M is the load of dust in unit of (g m −2), and e = 0.6 m 2 g −1 is the mass extinction efficiency. We compared the derived DOD with the DOD output from the GFLD-CM3 model
57 for one historical simulation, and the overall pattern is well captured by this method, with pattern correlations (for the 1861–2005 average) in a range from 0.94 in winter to 1.00 in summer and fall. The magnitude of DOD is underestimated by 26–36% over the southern Great Plains, 16–33% over the northern Great Plains and 5–27% over the western U.S.
